channel.title: PlayerSave nulling characters [Runesource]
channel.description:
Hello, I'm having an issue. Ever since I've added some ints and booleans to my playersave, any time I log out of a freshly made account, the ints and booleans go all weird on the player.
An example:
[i]New player logs in.[/i] [i]A variable is naturally set at 0.[/i] [i]Player logs out.[/i] [i]Player logs back in.[/i] [i]The int that WAS 0 becomes 16777215.[/i] [i]Every int becomes that value and every boolean is randomly set from null, true, or false[/i]
That's what's happening for me, can anyone give me some tips? I've also been using the 2006Memorys source as my base.

item.title: PlayerSave nulling characters [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

I’ve fixed it, just took the block of code where I added the ints and booleans above some other ones.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

You are aware the saves aren’t compatible correct? ._.

Read full topic

item.title: PlayerSave nulling characters [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

Hello, I’m having an issue. Ever since I’ve added some ints and booleans to my playersave, any time I log out of a freshly made account, the ints and booleans go all weird on the player.

An example:

New player logs in.
A variable is naturally set at 0.
Player logs out.
Player logs back in.
The int that WAS 0 becomes 16777215.
Every int becomes that value and every boolean is randomly set from null, true, or false

That’s what’s happening for me, can anyone give me some tips? I’ve also been using the 2006Memorys source as my base.

Read full topic
